CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 26,45 Therefore , each fractional unit in the DTPD may exert a synergetic effect to permit strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization by the quinoid structure and to locate HOMO and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) levels of resulting low band gap polymers in a deep state when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD (26,45) |
| quinoid structure |
| resulting low band gap polymers |
| donor moiety |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD (26,45) |
| resulting low band gap polymers |

The term "quinoid structure" is not a material name, but rather a description of the structure of the DTPD or the resulting polymers. Similarly, "donor moiety" refers to a functional group or moiety that acts as an electron donor, but it is not a specific material name.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 26,45 Therefore , each fractional unit in the DTPD may exert a synergetic effect to permit strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization by the quinoid structure and to locate HOMO and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) levels of resulting low band gap polymers in a deep state when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| each fractional unit in the DTPD |
| synergetic effect |
| quinoid structure |
| donor - acceptor electronic delocalization |
| resulting low band gap polymers |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) levels |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) levels |
| deep state |
| DTPD (Dithiophene-Thienothiophene copolymer) |
| appropriate donor moiety |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| synergetic effect |
| quinoid structure |
| resulting low band gap polymers |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) levels |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) levels |
| deep state |

Explanation:

* "26,45" and "Therefore" are not material properties.
* "each fractional unit in the DTPD" can be considered a material property, but it is not clearly defined in the paragraph and can be interpreted as a structural property rather than a material property.
* "strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization" is a property, but it is a composite property made up of "donor moiety" and "acceptor" which are not explicitly stated as material properties in the paragraph.
* "permits" and "to locate" are not material properties.
* "when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety" is not a material property.
* "appropriate donor moiety" is not a material property.

Therefore, only the following entities can be considered material properties: synergetic effect, quinoid structure, resulting low band gap polymers, HOMO levels, LUMO levels, and deep state.

Explanation:

The following entities were removed as they do not clearly refer to material properties:

* strong donor: This is a description of the donor moiety and does not represent a material property.
* appropriate: This is a description of the donor moiety and does not represent a material property.

The remaining entities are all material properties or represent the materials being described.
